snippet: A Michael Jackson tribute show by Cirque du Soleil startled China’s capital with a brief flash of a censored 1989 photo of a man facing down tanks near Tiananmen.
abstract: Memo From Beijing; tribute to Michael Jackson during performance by Cirque du Soleil in Beijing shows Tank Man photograph, image of lone man facing down tanks near Tiananmen Square; Communist Party suppresses any mention of 1989 violence and Cirque du Soleil quickly cut image from subsequent shows; photo's appearance underscores challenges that governments face in controlling history in the modern age.

byline.contributor: Marc Santora contributed reporting from New York, and Mia Li contributed research from Beijing.

lead_paragraph: A Michael Jackson tribute show by Cirque du Soleil startled China’s capital with a brief flash of a censored 1989 photo of a man facing down tanks near Tiananmen.

headline.main: Amid Tribute to King of Pop, an Echo of Tiananmen Square
headline.print_headline: Amid Tribute to King of Pop, An Echo of Tiananmen
